title: Question 25
prompt:
Sentence 15: We will finalize the dress code next week, and it will be implemented after the Winter break.

Which is the best way to write the underlined portion of this sentence? If the original is the best way, choose option (A).
description: Click the <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback:
The error in the sentence is the capitalization of the word “Winter.” A word is capitalized if it is at the beginning of the sentence or if it is a proper noun. A proper noun is the name of a specific individual, organization, place, or object, such as “Cesar Chavez,” “President Truman,” “United Nations,” “Baghdad,” or “World Health Organization.” “Winter” is not at the beginning of the sentence, and it is not a proper noun. The names of seasons—spring, summer, winter, fall, or autumn—are not capitalized.
We will finalize the dress code next week, and it will be implemented after the winterbreak.
